title: Salad Nicoise Lettuce Cups
summary: The recipe Salad Nicoise Lettuce Cups could satisfy your Mediterranean craving in about 45 minutes. This main course has 502 calories, 40g of protein, and 35g of fat per serving. This gluten free, primal, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian recipe serves 4 and costs $1.73 per serving. If you have pepper, parmesan, hard-cooked eggs, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 87%. This score is super. Try Seared Rare Ni√ßoise Tuna Lettuce Cups, Herbed Pea Salad in Lettuce Cups, and Veggie Salad in Lettuce Cups for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Bordeaux, Champagne, and White Burgundy are my top picks for French. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. The Chateau Le Grand Moulin Cotes de Bordeaux Blaye with a 4.8 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 15 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Chateau Le Grand Moulin Cotes de Bordeaux Blaye
productMatches.description: Mostly Merlot, with Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, and Malbec and aged in cement vats. Generous, ripe and fruit forward aromas of dark currant, blackberry, cassis, mint, and spice with touches of earthiness. The medium bodied palate has nice balanced aromas supported by refined, textured tannins and balanced acidity. The finish is savory with earthy flavors and very good length.

instructions: Crumble tuna. Divide between lettuce leaves. Top with egg chunks and a few tablespoons grated Parmesan. Drizzle with dressing. Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.

steps.step: Crumble tuna. Divide between lettuce leaves. Top with egg chunks and a few tablespoons grated Parmesan.
Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.
